original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries yields edge up, low take up 3-month bills
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 85 billion rupees of Treasury bills, with yields rising across maturities, and lower take up of 3-month bills, data from the state debt office showed.
The 3-month yield was up 2 basis points at 7.62 percent, with 30 billion rupees offered and 7.42 billion sold.
The 6-month yield was up 7 basis points at 7.91 percent, with 30 billion offered and 55.77 billion sold.
The 12-month yield was up 5 basis points at 8.04 percent with 25 billion rupees of bills offered and 21.8 billion rupees bills sold.
The 3-month and 12-month bills are available on tap at the weighted average yield.
